section.name: JEXL Flags
section.p: JETT uses an internal "JEXL Engine", supplied by the Apache Commons JEXL library, to evaluate the expressions. The ExcelTransformer passes two flags through to the JexlEngine, "silent" and "lenient". The "silent" flag tells the JexlEngine not to write errors to standard output. The "lenient" flag tells the JexlEngine to allow such things as converting nulls to zeroes, NullPointerExceptions to null, etc. Otherwise, JEXL might throw an Exception or write a log message to standard output.
JETT exposes control of these flags through methods in the ExcelTransformer class.
section.source: public void setLenient(boolean lenient); public void setSilent(boolean silent);
